result.markdown: --- title: "Maximum likelihood and testing" --- ### Content ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |S |Content | PDF | Videos | SAS | R | |:--|:--------------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------:| |2d |Hypothesis tests |[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w2d_tests.pdf)|[](https://youtu.be/PatlZ9mlVuk)|[](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/code/MATH60604A_2d_tests.sas)|[](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/code/MATH60604A_2d_tests.R)| |3 |Likelihood-based inference |[](https://lbelzile.github.io/MATH60604A-slides/MATH60604A_w3_likelihood.pdf)|[](https://youtu.be/IO3et3Uk4mQ)| |[](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/code/MATH60604A_3_likelihood.R)| ::: ::: - Course notes: chapter 3, chapter 2 (section 4) ### In class: - [**R** demo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/files/code/60604A-profile.R): sampling distribution of OLS, profile likelihood for individual coefficients - [Interpretation of **SAS** output and tests for the `insurance` data](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/files/code/60604A-tests_linear_models.sas) - [**Understanding Maximum Likelihood** by Kristoffer Magnusson](https://rpsychologist.com/d3/likelihood/) ## After class - [Exercise sheet 2](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/files/exercises/MATH60604A-Exercise2.pdf) - [Tests as linear models](https://lindeloev.github.io/tests-as-linear/)
